poem:
"Voices in the Chambers"

Kemi stands,
Her claims held high,
Against the shadow of the ex-post's chair.
The assembly stirs, a sea of faces,
Citizens casting stones of policy.

Gray whispers in Starmer's ear,
Words sketched on the canvas of controversy.
Oh, listen to the song of politics,
Rising with the dawn,
Ring the bell, there is much to tell.
